alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:32AM CDT until April 05 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN...SOUTHEASTERN CRAWFORD AND NORTHEASTERN SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 531 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lavaca, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Alma... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Kibler... Central City... Peter Pender... Vesta... Cecil... Ursula... This includes Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 14 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
